alert.note: Alert for Atoka; Coal; Hughes; Johnston; Pontotoc; Seminole (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 24 at 11:26AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Johnston, Coal, southeastern Seminole, eastern Pontotoc, western Atoka and Hughes Counties through 1230 PM CDT... At 1125 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles south of Wewoka to near Milburn. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Holdenville, Atoka, Coalgate, Wewoka, Wetumka, Allen, Stonewall, Wapanucka, Stringtown, Dustin, Lehigh, Tupelo, Milburn, Tushka, Calvin, Caney, Stuart, Bromide, Lamar and Sasakwa. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Atoka; Coal; Hughes; Johnston; Pontotoc; Seminole
